[LEXICON]: Occasionally archaic vocabulary and complex sentence structures may challenge modern readers.

[TRANSITION]: Some paragraphs (e.g., discussion of Royal Academy discourses) feel loosely connected to preceding context.
[STRUCTURE]: Minor abrupt shifts between biographical details and artistic analysis.

[SYNTAX]: Awkwardly long sentences (e.g., "He had human weaknesses...")
[TRANSITION]: Minor abrupt shifts between paragraphs (e.g., artists’ personalities to friendships)

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt ending with unrelated livestream mention
[TRANSITION]: Tangential comparison to modern music halls
[LOGIC]: Slight disjoint between criticizing Reynolds’ flaws and praising his acquaintances
